A: 1. Non living things can eat? (a) True (b) False
2. Non living things have legs? (a) True (b) False
3. We can identify many things by (a) Size (b) Height (c) Colours
4. What is the colour of a ripe banana? (a) Green (b) Yellow (c) White
5. What is the colour of a ripe tomato? (a) Yellow (b) Red (c) Green
6. How many colors does a Nigeria flag have? (a) 2 (b) 3
7. A traffic light has how many colours? (a) 3 (b) 2 (c) 6
8. The red light on a traffic light means (a) Stop (b) Get ready (c) Go
9. The green light on a traffic light means (a) Go (b) Stop (c) Get ready
10. A hibiscus flower is a plant? (a) True (b) False
11. Those things that can grow, eat, and move are called (a) Living things (b) Non-living things
12. There are how many types of living things? (a) 2 (b) 4 (c) 6
13. Plants and _______ are living things (a) Animals (b) Stones (c) Sand
14. _______ is a living thing at home (a) Dog (b) Plate (c) Chair
15. Which one of the following is not a living thing? (a) Money (b) Boy (c) Cat
16. _______ is a plant (a) Maize plant (b) Stick (c) Lion
17. _______ is an animal (a) Goat (b) Mango (c) Moon
18. _______ objects cannot do what living things do (a) Non-living things (b) Living things (c) Cow
19. Non-living things cannot grow? (a) True (b) False
20. All the following are examples of non living things except one (a) Rat (b) Cup (c) Plate
B: 1. The red light on the traffic light means_________
2. The green light on the traffic light means_________
3. Those things that have life in them are called_________
4. Those things that do not have life in them are called_________
5. _______ is an example of a plant
C: 2. What is a non living thing?
3. List two examples of living things.
4. List two examples of non living things.
